Class GameMapController

java.lang.Object
com.game.controllers.GameMapController
Direct Known Subclasses:
GameMapControllerbot, GameMapControllerFlag
public class GameMapController extends Object
Controller class responsible for managing the game map, including player movements, bomb placements, power-up handling, and transitions to the game over screen.

    Inner class for storing a player, their cell, and controls

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the game map, players, bombs, and sets up input handling and the animation loop.

    • createPlayers

      protected Player[] createPlayers()
      Creates and returns two players initialized with default positions and states.
      Returns:
      an array containing player 1 and player 2

    • handleKeyPressed

      protected void handleKeyPressed(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
      Handles key press events and bomb placements.
      Parameters:
      event - the key press event

    • handleKeyReleased

      protected void handleKeyReleased(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
      Handles key release events by updating the pressed key set.
      Parameters:
      event - the key release event

    • startMovementLoop

      protected void startMovementLoop()
      Starts the animation loop responsible for moving players and applying power-up effects.

    • movePlayerIfPossible

      protected void movePlayerIfPossible(Player player, javafx.scene.layout.StackPane cell, int dRow, int dCol)
      Moves the player in the given direction if the destination is walkable.
      Parameters:
      player - the player to move
      cell - the StackPane representing the player on the grid
      dRow - the row direction offset
      dCol - the column direction offset

    • isWalkable

      protected boolean isWalkable(int row, int col)
      Determines whether a given map cell is walkable.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index
      col - the column index
      Returns:
      true if the cell is walkable, false otherwise

    • killPlayer

      public void killPlayer(Player player)
      Marks a player as dead, removes them from the grid, and checks for a winner.
      Parameters:
      player - the player to mark as dead

    • switchToGameOverScreen

      protected void switchToGameOverScreen(String winnerText, int P1Score, int P2Score)
      Switches to the game over screen and displays the scores.
      Parameters:
      winnerText - the message indicating the winner
      P1Score - the score of player 1
      P2Score - the score of player 2

    • spawnPowerUpAt

      public void spawnPowerUpAt(int row, int col)
      Spawns a new power-up at the given grid coordinates.
      Parameters:
      row - the row coordinate
      col - the column coordinate
